intro: Lespedeza cyrtobotrya f. alba, commonly known as white lespedeza, is a perennial legume native to East Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has trifoliate leaves and produces small, elliptical seed pods. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or disturbed areas. Due to its ornamental value and nitrogen-fixing ability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and ecological restoration projects.
